name: FurtherAI
headline: AI Workforce for the Insurance Industry
description: FurtherAI is building a workforce of AI Teammates for the insurance industry to handle repetitive manual tasks involving unstructured data processing and data entry across disjointed systems. Our first AI Teammate handles quote generation workflows for insurance brokers & MGAs.

founders.name: Aman Gour, Founder
founders.description:
Aman Gour is the Co-founder/CEO of FurtherAI. 

Previously he co-founded, TurboHire - a platform for recruitment automation, where he was responsible for scaling up the revenue to over $1m in ARR. He has approximately 10 years of experience in developing workflow automation solutions for various industries.

Before that, he worked as a Product Manager at Microsoft after obtaining a degree in computer science from IIT Bombay (India)

founders.name: Sashank Gondala, CTO/Co-founder
founders.description:
Sashank Gondala is the co-founder and CTO of FurtherAI. Previously, he is a former language modeling scientist at Apple, where he built and scaled language models for Siri. 

Sashank is a Computer Science graduate from IIT Bombay and later did his Masters in Computer Science (Machine Learning) from Georgia Tech where he conducted research in multimodal AI alongside industry-leading scientists.

generated_description:
**FurtherAI: Building the Future of Insurance Operations with AI**

Founded in 2023, FurtherAI is on a mission to revolutionize the insurance industry by creating a powerful workforce of AI teammates specifically designed to streamline operations. Located in the heart of innovation—part of the Y Combinator Batch W24—this startup is responding to a critical need: the handling of tedious, repetitive manual tasks that plague insurance brokers and Managing General Agents (MGAs).

At its core, FurtherAI automates processes that deal with unstructured data and disjointed systems. Their initial offering dives into quote generation workflows, allowing brokers and MGAs to improve efficiency significantly while cutting down on human error. Their flagship AI teammates include Grace AI, which automates quote generation; Smith AI, which checks policy consistency; and Kate AI, which manages renewal follow-ups. 

With a lean team of just two employees, FurtherAI is surprisingly nimble. Their approach focuses on collaboration with innovative insurance brokers and agents, creating a dynamic that empowers these professionals to delegate routine tasks, allowing them to concentrate on more strategic activities. 

Feedback from the field has been promising. Users rave about the ease of tuning AI teammates to specific tasks, claiming these innovations act like a godsend in reducing redundancy in their workflows. Support from Group Partner Tom Blomfield reflects a robust backing, which bodes well for their future endeavors.

If you find your insurance operations bogged down by repetitive tasks, it might be time to consider whether an AI teammate could be the solution. Interested parties are encouraged to schedule a demo or get in touch through FurtherAI's website at [furtherai.com](https://www.furtherai.com/).

In summary, FurtherAI is not just creating another tool; they are engineering a transformation in the insurance landscape, one AI at a time.
